DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $54,369 TO SUPPORT THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT FOR ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE REVIEW OF REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AND FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND RECORDS OF DECISION AT SUPERFUND SITES IN ALABAMA WHEN THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) IS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR REMEDIAL ACTION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ADEM WILL IMPLEMENT ITS OWN PROJECT TO SUPPORT SITE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES RELATED TO REMEDIAL INVESTIGATIONS, FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND REMEDIAL DESIGNS AT EPA LEAD SITES PURSUANT TO CERCLA. ACTIVITIES ALSO INCLUDE REVIEW OF INFORMATION, ATTENDING SITE-RELATED MEETINGS AND PARTICIPATING IN FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS. EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THIS AGREEMENT WILL ALLOW THE STATE TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE TO THE EPA AND ANTICIPATED DELIVERIES WILL INCLUDE REPORTS FOR PRE-REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS OF ALABAMA.ACTIVITIES:.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $53,075 TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO CONDUCT A REVIEW OF REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AND FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND RECORDS OF DECISION AT SUPERFUND SITES IN MISSISSIPPI. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE REMEDIAL INVESTIGATIONS, FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND REMEDIAL DESIGNS AT ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) LEAD SITES PURSUANT TO COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA). ACTIVITIES ALSO INCLUDE REVIEW OF INFORMATION, ATTENDING SITE-RELATED MEETINGS AND PARTICIPATING IN FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE REPORTS FOR PRE-REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES AND ALLOW THE STATE TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE TO THE EPA. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF MISSISSIPPI, THAT WILL BENEFIT FROM THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. ACTIVITIES:-SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:-

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $16,535 TO SUPPORT THE ALABAMA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT FOR ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE REVIEW OF REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AND FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND RECORDS OF DECISION AT SUPERFUND SITES IN ALABAMA WHEN THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) IS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR REMEDIAL ACTION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: INCLUDE REVIEW OF INFORMATION, ATTENDING SITE-RELATED MEETINGS, REVIEWING, AND COMMENTING ON TECHNICAL DOCUMENTS AND PARTICIPATING IN FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS. THE AGREEMENT WILL ALLOW THE STATE TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE TO EPA AT NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL), NPL CALIBER AND FEDERAL SITE OF INTEREST IN ALABAMA THROUGHOUT THE REMEDIAL RESPONSE ACTION IN THE FORM OF DOCUMENT REVIEW AND COMMENTS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THIS AGREEMENT WILL ALLOW THE STATE TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE TO THE EPA. THE STATE WILL REVIEW AND COMMENT ON TECHNICAL DOCUMENTS DURING THE REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION/FEASIBILITY STUDY PHASE (RI/FS), SUCH AS THE RI/FS WORK PLAN, AND THE FIELD SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS PLAN. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF ALABAMA, THAT WILL BENEFIT FROM THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL INVOLVE THE STATE GENERATING A REPORT IN THE FORM OF A FIVE-YEAR REVIEW. NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.ACTIVITIES:.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $552,730 TO THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND CONSERVATION (TDEC). THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE RECIPIENT'S PROGRAM TO CONDUCT REMEDIAL ACTION ACTIVITIES AT THE VELSICOL HARDEMAN COUNTY LANDFILL HAZARDOUS WASTE SITE, WHICH IS LISTED ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) OF THE NATIONAL OIL AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CONTINGENCY PLAN. THE PURPOSE FOR THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE MONITORING, REPORTING, AND OVERSIGHT FOR THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S (EPA) SELECTED CONTRACTORS, WHO WILL BE PERFORMING REMEDIAL ACTION ACTIVITIES AT THE SITE. ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING SITE-SPECIFIC ACTIONS: TDEC WILL OVERSEE THE REMEDIATION CONTRACTOR; COMMUNICATE DAILY WITH EPA REGARDING SITE ACTIVITIES AND ISSUES; ACCOMPANY AND SUPPORT THE CONTRACTOR WITH PERIMETER AIR SAMPLING, GROUNDWATER SAMPLING, AND AIR MONITORING AS NEEDED. TDEC WILL ALSO COMMUNICATE WITH THE EPA ON SITE ISSUES, SUCH AS COST CONTROL ISSUES, DELAYS, CONTRACTOR STAFFING CONCERNS, HEALTH AND SAFETY CONCERNS. TDEC WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT TO THE EPA FOR COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ACTIVITIES, AND THE EPA WILL UTILIZE THE EXISTING COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN (CIP), WHICH WILL ALLOW COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT AND PUBLIC PARTICIPATION DURING THE REMEDIATION PROCESS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES AND EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE PRIMARY COMPONENTS FOR THE NORTH DISPOSAL AREA, SOIL VAPOR EXTRACTION TREATMENT SYSTEM REMEDIAL ACTION AND ONGOING PERIMETER AIR SAMPLING. TDEC WILL EVALUATE THE CONCEPTUAL SITE MODEL AND INCORPORATED DATA FROM ON-SITE AND OFF-SITE SAMPLING. THE STATE WILL ASSIST THE EPA WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF DATA QUALITY OBJECTIVES FOR ADDITIONAL DATA THAT MAY BE NEEDED TO EVALUATE POTENTIAL RESPONSE ACTION(S). THIS WILL OCCUR ONGOING FOLLOWING THE COLLECTION OF GROUNDWATER SAMPLES. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF TENNESSEE.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $126,060 TO THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORT WITH PERFORMING SITE CHARACTERIZATION ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PRELIMINARY ASSESSMENTS AND SITE INSPECTIONS AT POTENTIAL OR CONFIRMED HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES. THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $85,452 TO THE SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL (SCDHEC) FOR ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE REVIEW OF REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AND FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND RECORDS OF DECISION AT SUPERFUND SITES IN SOUTH CAROLINA WHEN THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) IS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR REMEDIAL ACTION.  ACTIVITIES CAN ALSO INCLUDE REVIEW OF INFORMATION, ATTENDING SITE-RELATED MEETINGS AND PARTICIPATING IN FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS. THE DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE REPORTS FOR PRE-REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES. THE OUTCOME OF THIS AGREEMENT WILL ALLOW THE STATE TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE TO THE EPA. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF SOUTH CAROLINA, THAT WILL BENEFIT FROM THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT.

THE OUTCOME OF THIS AGREEMENT WILL ALLOW THE STATE TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE TO THE EPA. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS $805,000 TO THE STATE OF UTAH'S DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY. UDEQ WILL BE THE LEAD AGENCY FOR THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE (OANDM) ACTIVITIES AT EUREKA MILLS SUPERFUND SITE. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL ALSO CONTRACT FOR REQUIRED MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR WORK ASSOCIATED WITH REMEDIAL ACTION STRUCTURES IN MINE WASTE AREAS, COMPLETE THE FIFTH FIVE YEAR REVIEW, AND SUPPORT EUREKA CITY IN THE IMPLEMENTATION AND ENFORCEMENT ON INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS AND CONDUCT MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES AT THE OPEN CELL REPOSITORY AND EUREKA GULCH.ACTIVITIES:THE DERR HAS PROVIDED FUNDING TO EUREKA CITY TO IMPLEMENT AND ENFORCE THE 'SPECIAL REGULATIONS-EUREKA MILLS SUPERFUND SITE' IN THE LAND USE ORDINANCE OF EUREKA (EXCAVATION ORDINANCE) AND TO MAINTAIN DAILY OPERATION OF THE OPEN CELL AND MANAGEMENT OF THE STOCKPILED MATERIAL. THE DERR WILL PROVIDE OVERSIGHT OF EUREKA CITY ACTIVITIES RELATIVE TO ENFORCEMENT OF THE EXCAVATION ORDINANCE. EUREKA CITY HAS RESPONSIBILITY FOR MAINTENANCE OF THE EUREKA GULCH. THIS INCLUDES THE REMOVAL OF NOXIOUS WEEDS, VEGETATION AND TREES THAT COULD IMPACT THE FLOW OF THE UPPER AND LOWER PORTIONS OF EUREKA GULCH. THE DERR PROVIDES OVERSIGHT TO EUREKA CITY ASSOCIATED WITH MAINTENANCE OF EUREKA GULCH. EUREKA CITY IS RESPONSIBLE FOR IMPLEMENTATION AND ENFORCEMENT OF THE EXCAVATION ORDINANCE. UPON REQUEST, THE DERR WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT TO EUREKA CITY BY CONSULTING WITH THE CITY CONCERNING ENFORCEMENT PRACTICES. CITY PERSONNEL (WHICH COULD INCLUDE CITY COUNCIL AND MAYOR) WILL BE AVAILABLE TO MEET WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO DISCUSS ORDINANCE REQUIREMENTS AND PURPOSE, AND HOW TO STAY IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE ORDINANCE. THE DERR WILL ASSIST EUREKA CITY, AS NECESSARY, IN COMMUNITY OUTREACH ACTIVITIES RELATIVE TO IMPLEMENTATION AND ENFORCEMENT OF THE ORDINANCE. THE DERR WILL USE CONTRACTOR SUPPORT, AS NECESSARY, TO ASSIST IN OANDM ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING ICS, MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR OF THE RASS, GRADING/COMPACTION, AND TEMPORARY CAPPING OF THE OPEN CELL REPOSITORY. THE DERR WILL PREPARE AND APPROVE WORK ASSIGNMENTS, CONTRACT DOCUMENTS, REVIEW INVOICES AND OTHER MATERIALS RELEVANT TO CONTRACTUAL WORK. THE DERR WILL REVIEW ARARS AS THEY RELATE TO THE COMPLIANCE OF IC'S AND PROTECTION OF THE REMEDY. THE DERR WILL PROVIDE TRAINING SUPPORT TO EUREKA CITY PERSONNEL TO ENSURE THE PROPER IMPLEMENTATION AND ENFORCEMENT OF THE ICS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ENSURES THAT THE INTEGRITY OF THE REMEDIAL ACTION IS NOT COMPROMISED AND THAT CONSTRUCTED FEATURES OF THE REMEDIAL ACTION REMAIN PROTECTIVE OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. IT ALSO ENSURES THE CONTINUED PROTECTIVENESS OF THE REMEDIAL ACTION STRUCTURES AND INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE JUAB COUNTY AND THE RESIDENTS OF UTAH.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE RECIPIENT'S PROGRAM TO CONDUCT OPERATION, MAINTENANCE, MONITORING, AND FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS AT THE SHARON STEEL SUPERFUND SITE, OPERABLE UNIT 01, WHICH IS LISTED ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) OF THE NATIONAL OIL AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CONTINGENCY PLAN.

.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING SITE-SPECIFIC ACTIONS:

TASK 1 - PROJECT MANAGEMENT
- THE DERR WILL PERFORM ALL PROJECT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES REQUIRED TO EFFECTIVELY MANAGE LONG TERM OPERATION, MAINTENANCE, AND MONITORING AT THE SITE IN ORDER TO ENSURE THAT THE REMEDY REMAINS INTACT AND CONTINUES TO FUNCTION AS DESIGNED. TELEPHONE USE, POSTAGE, PHOTOCOPYING, AND OTHER INDIRECT COSTS WILL BE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATE'S APPROVED INDIRECT COST RATE.
- THE DERR PROJECT MANAGER WILL COORDINATE GROUNDWATER RELATED TASKS AS APPROPRIATE WITH OTHER DERR STAFF AND MANAGEMENT, EPA, THE CITY OF MIDVALE AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS.
- THE DERR WILL TRACK THE PROJECT BUDGET AND REQUEST FUNDING AS NEEDED (INCLUDING REQUESTING FUNDING TO PERFORM FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS AT THE SITE).
- THE DERR PROJECT MANAGER WILL PROVIDE THE DERR MANAGEMENT AND THE EPA WITH STATUS UPDATES REGARDING GROUNDWATER MONITORING AND SAMPLING AND OTHER RELEVANT ISSUES RELATED TO OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE COMPLETED REMEDY.
- THE DERR PROJECT MANAGER MAY ALSO BE REQUIRED TO PERFORM OTHER DUTIES NOT SPECIFICALLY OUTLINED IN THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO ENSURE THAT THE REMEDY REMAINS INTACT AND CONTINUES TO FUNCTION AS INTENDED.

TASK 2 - INSPECTION
THE DERR OR ITS CONTRACTOR WILL PERFORM SEMIANNUAL SITE INSPECTIONS ACCORDING TO GUIDELINES DESCRIBED IN THE OPERATION, MAINTENANCE, AND MONITORING MANUAL DEVELOPED FOR SHARON STEEL. SEMIANNUAL INSPECTIONS WILL OBSERVE GENERAL CONDITIONS OF THE SITE, INTEGRITY OF THE REMEDY, AND ANY MAINTENANCE ISSUES THAT MAY NEED TO BE ADDRESSED.

TASK 3 - MONITORING, SAMPLING, AND ANALYSIS
THE DERR OR ITS CONTRACTOR WILL PERFORM ANNUAL GROUNDWATER AND SURFACE WATER MONITORING, SAMPLING, AND ANALYSIS. GROUNDWATER AND SURFACE WATER MONITORING, SAMPLING, AND ANALYSIS WILL BE COMPLETED ACCORDING TO GUIDELINES DESCRIBED IN THE OPERATION, MAINTENANCE, AND MONITORING MANUAL DEVELOPED FOR SHARON STEEL. ALL SAMPLES WILL BE ANALYZED FOR TOTAL AND DISSOLVED ARSENIC. THE DERR WILL NOTIFY EPA TEN (10) CALENDAR DAYS PRIOR TO THE INITIATION OF FIELD SAMPLING ACTIVITIES. THE DERR WILL REVIEW SAMPLING RECORDS FOR COMPLIANCE WITH SPECIFIC ACTION LEVELS ESTABLISHED FOR ARSENIC CONTAMINATION IN GROUNDWATER AND SURFACE WATER AT THE SHARON STEEL SITE.

TASK 4 - REPORTING
THE DERR OR ITS CONTRACTOR WILL DEVELOP AND PROVIDE TO EPA GROUNDWATER AND SURFACE WATER MONITORING, SAMPLING REPORTS, SEMIANNUAL INSPECTION REPORTS AND FIVE-YEAR REVIEW REPORTS. A DRAFT COPY OF THESE REPORTS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE EPA FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT PRIOR TO PREPARING AND DISTRIBUTING THE FINAL COPY OF THE REPORT TO THE EPA AND APPROPRIATE STAKEHOLDERS.

TASK 5 - SITE REDEVELOPMENT
THE DERR WILL ATTEND MEETINGS REGARDING SITE REDEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES THAT WOULD DIRECTLY IMPACT THE REMEDY COMPLETED AT THE SITE. THE DERR OR ITS CONTRACTOR WILL REVIEW, AS NEEDED, DOCUMENTS RELATED TO SITE REDEVELOPMENT INCLUDING UTILITY SERVICE INFRASTRUCTURE, BUILDINGS, ROADS, LANDSCAPE, AND OTHER PROPERTY RELATED IMPROVEMENTS.

THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE RECIPIENT'S PROGRAM TO CONDUCT OPERATION, MAINTENANCE AND MONITORING OF THE COMPLETED REMEDIAL ACTION AND FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS AT THE PORTLAND CEMENT NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) SITE OF THE NATIONAL OIL AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CONTINGENCY PLAN.

TO ENSURE THAT THE SELECTED REMEDY FOR THIS NATIONAL PRIORITY LIST SITE CONTINUES TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

TELEPHONE USE, POSTAGE, PHOTOCOPYING AND OTHER INDIRECT COSTS WILL BE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATE'S APPROVED INDIRECT COST RATE.
#9679; THE DERR PROJECT MANAGER WILL COORDINATE OANDM AND GROUNDWATER RELATED TASKS AS APPROPRIATE WITH OTHER DERR STAFF AND MANAGEMENT, EPA, AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS.
#9679; THE DERR WILL TRACK THE PROJECT BUDGET AND REQUEST FUNDING AS NEEDED (INCLUDING REQUESTING FUNDING TO PERFORM FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS AT THE SITE).
#9679; THE DERR WILL COORDINATE WITH THE EPA ON THE APPROPRIATE FREQUENCY FOR FUTURE GROUND AND SURFACE WATER MONITORING EVENTS. THE DERR ANTICIPATES THAT FUTURE MONITORING AND SAMPLING WILL BE CONDUCTED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.
#9679; THE DERR PROJECT MANAGER WILL PROVIDE THE DERR MANAGEMENT AND THE EPA WITH STATUS UPDATES REGARDING GROUNDWATER MONITORING AND SAMPLING AND OTHER RELEVANT ISSUES RELATED TO OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES.
TASK 2 - INSPECTION 
THE DERR WILL IMPLEMENT ADMINISTRATIVE AND TECHNICAL DETAILS AND REQUIREMENTS FOR INSPECTING, OPERATING, AND MAINTAINING THE REMEDY ACCORDING TO GUIDELINES IN THE OANDM PLAN. INSPECTION OF ALL WELL HEADS AND CASINGS WILL BE COMPLETED DURING EACH MONITORING AND SAMPLING EVENT TO ENSURE THAT THE REMEDY COMPONENTS REMAIN INTACT AND CONTINUE TO FUNCTION AS DESIGNED.
TASK 3 - MONITORING, SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS
THE DERR WILL PERFORM GROUNDWATER AND SURFACE WATER MONITORING, SAMPLING, AND ANALYSIS. GROUND AND SURFACE WATER MONITORING WILL CONSIST OF SAMPLING EIGHTEEN (18) MONITORING WELLS AND ONE (1) SURFACE WATER LOCATION ANNUALLY. THE DERR WILL NOTIFY THE EPA TEN (10) CALENDAR DAYS PRIOR TO THE INITIATION OF FIELD SAMPLING ACTIVITIES. THE DERR WILL REVIEW SAMPLING RECORDS FOR COMPLIANCE WITH SPECIFIC ACTION LEVELS ESTABLISHED FOR CONTAMINANTS OF CONCERN IN GROUNDWATER AND SURFACE WATER AT THE SITE.
TASK 4 - REPORTING
THE DERR WILL DEVELOP GROUND AND SURFACE WATER MONITORING AND SAMPLING REPORTS, AND FIVE-YEAR REVIEW REPORTS. A DRAFT COPY OF THESE REPORTS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE EPA FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT PRIOR TO PREPARING AND DISTRIBUTING THE FINAL COPY OF THE REPORT TO THE EPA AND APPROPRIATE STAKEHOLDERS. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS SPECIFIC TO ROUTINE OANDM WORK AND FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS.
4. COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT

DESCRIPTION:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS $75,752 TO THE STATE OF COLORADO'S DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL. COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT WILL BE THE LEAD AGENCY FOR THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE (OANDM) ACTIVITIES AT SAND CREEK SUPERFUND SITE. CDPHE WILL BE RESPONSIBLE SITE INSPECTION AND MONITORING; MAINTENANCE OF REMEDY COMPONENTS AND MONITORING EQUIPMENT; AND REPORTING OF SITE FINDINGS.ACTIVITIES:CDPHE CURRENTLY CONDUCTS SITE-WIDE WATER QUALITY MONITORING ACTIVITIES EVERY TWO YEARS AT THE SITE. MONITORING, AT A MINIMUM, INCLUDES COLLECTION OF ANALYTICAL SAMPLES, DOCUMENTATION OF WATER QUALITY PARAMETERS (INCLUDING DEPTH TO WATER IN GROUNDWATER WELLS, AND DOCUMENTATION OF ANY ISSUES WITH THE MONITORING NETWORK. IT IS EXPECTED THAT PERIODIC OANDM WILL BE REQUIRED FOR THE OU 4 MONITORING NETWORK. IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO PREDICT ALL FUTURE MAINTENANCE NEEDS AT THE SITE. HOWEVER, IT WILL INCLUDE, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, THE FOLLOWING REMEDY COMPONENTS: IN-SITU PUMPS, WELL RECONDITIONING, WELL RECONSTRUCTION AND WELL SECURITY (CAPS AND LOCKS). IT IS NECESSARY TO DOCUMENT THE RESULTS OF, OANDM AND MONITORING ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH OU 4.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:CONTINUED OANDM AND MONITORING IS REQUIRED FOR OU4 TO ENSURE THAT THE REMEDIAL ACTION TAKEN REMAINS PROTECTIVE OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR SAN JUAN COUNTY, COLORADO TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO EPA TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT AT THE BONITA PEAK SUPERFUND SITE. THIS AGREEMENT MAY FUND THE PARTICIPATION OF THE RECIPIENT IN ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE REVIEW OF REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AND FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND RECORDS OF DECISION AT THE BONITA PEAK SUPERFUND SITE WHEN THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) IS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR REMEDIAL ACTION. THIS CAN ALSO INCLUDE REVIEW OF INFORMATION, ATTENDING SITE-RELATED MEETINGS AND PARTICIPATING IN FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS. ACTIVITIES: TASK 1 - COUNTY ADMINISTRATOR BPMD COORDINATION 
TASK 1 REQUESTED FUNDING FOR THE COUNTY ADMINISTRATORS TIME IS TO ATTEND MEETINGS AND COORDINATE THE COUNTY'S PARTICIPATION IN BPMD ACTIVITIES. COUNTY ADMINISTRATOR TIME WILL COVER UPDATING AND MANAGING SAN JUAN COUNTY TO SUPPORT BPMD ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PLANNING, ROAD MAINTENANCE, EMERGENCY SERVICES, COMMUNITY UPDATES, PUBLIC HEALTH MATTERS, ELECTED OFFICIAL UPDATES AND WORK SESSIONS.  

TASK 2 -BPMD REDEVELOPMENT 
TASK 2 REQUESTED FUNDING FOR THE COUNTY PLANNERS TIME IS TO REVIEW AND COORDINATE WITH CDPHE THE MYRIAD OF APPLICATIONS BEING SUBMITTED TO SAN JUAN COUNTY FOR PROPOSED REDEVELOPMENT OF MINING CLAIMS, MOST NOTABLY CLAIMS WHICH FALL ON OR ADJACENT TO ONE OR MORE OF THE 48 LISTED SUPERFUND PARCELS IN THE COUNTY.  ADDITIONALLY, THE COUNTY PLANNER WILL BE UPDATING ELECTED OFFICIALS AND THE COUNTY ADMINISTRATOR PERTAINING TO THESE UNIQUE APPLICATIONS.

TASK 3 - BPMD COMMUNICATIONS
TASK 3 IS TO CONSISTENTLY IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN A HIGH QUALITY OF COMMUNICATION TO DOWNSTREAM STAKEHOLDERS IN THE ANIMAS RIVER AND SAN JUAN RIVER BASINS PERTAINING TO ONGOING REMEDIAL ACTIONS AT THE BONITA PEAK SUPERFUND SITE.  THE COMMUNICATIONS LIAISON SERVES AS THE PRIMARY INFORMATION OFFICER/PRESS CONTACT, AND COMMUNITY EDUCATION POINT OF CONTACT.  THE COMMUNICATIONS LIAISON WORKS CLOSELY WITH REGIONAL GOVERNMENT, FEDERAL, STATE, AND CONGRESSIONAL ENTITIES, REGIONAL WATER AGENCIES, NON-PROFITS, AND SERVES BOTH THE TOWN AND THE COUNTY TO ASSESS AND REPORT ON ACTIVITIES, EVENTS, COMPLIANCE, AND EPA COORDINATION.  

TASK 4 - SAN JUAN COUNTY ROAD AND BRIDGE ASSISTANCE
TASK 4 PROVIDES FOR 10% OF THE ANNUAL SNOW REMOVAL AND DUST SUPPRESSION OF AFFECTED ROADS IN SAN JUAN COUNTY. THIS PERCENTAGE IS BASED  ON THE ESTIMATED COSTS FOR THE LABOR AND EQUIPMENT NECESSARY  TO MAINTAIN THE ROADS  THAT PROVIDE ACCESS TO REMEDIATION SITES AND THE WATER TREATMENT PLANT   THIS TASK WILL ADDRESS SNOW REMOVAL THROUGHOUT THE WINTER MONTHS (NOVEMBER TO MAY) AND  AS NECESSARY UNTIL ACCESS IS SECURED FOR THE SUMMER ON CR110 FROM SILVERTON TO GLADSTONE. THIS WILL FACILITATE EPA MAINTENANCE OF WATER TREATMENT OPERATIONS AT THE GLADSTONE PLANT.  IN THE LATE SPRING THROUGH EARLY FALL (MAY TO OCTOBER) THIS TASK WILL FACILITATE SAN JUAN COUNTY TO PROVIDE DUST SUPPRESSION ON CR110 AND CR2. TASK 4 ALSO PROVIDES FOR PURCHASING  A WATER TRUCK WHICH WILL INTENSIVELY PROVIDE FOR DUST SUPPRESSION ON CR110 BETWEEN GLADSTONE AND SILVERTON AND ON CR2 BETWEEN EUREKA AND SILVERTON. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE IN SUPPORT OF SUPERFUND ACTIVITIES.

BENEFICIARIES WOULD INCLUDE THE TOWN OF SILVERTON, ELECTED OFFICIALS, PRIVATE PROPERTY OWNERS, FEDERAL LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCIES, EPA, THE STATE, AND PRIVATE CONTRACTORS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENTS FUNDS COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT  TO PERFORM AND OVERSEE THE PERFORMANCE OF OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE AT THE CALIFORNIA GULCH SUPERFUND SITE. THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO ENSURE THAT THE REMEDY CONTINUES TO PROTECT THE COMMUNITY. EPA IS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR THE REMEDIAL ACTION AND THE CDPHE SHALL SUPPORT EPA BY PERFORMING THE OVERSIGHT, MONITORING, MAINTENANCE, AND REPORTING. 

ACTIVITIES:THE CDPHE SHALL SUPPORT EPA BY PERFORMING THE FOLLOWING: 
OVERSIGHT:
A. CDPHE WILL CONDUCT PROJECT OVERSIGHT AND WILL MONITOR THE PERFORMANCE OF ALL CONTRACTORS. SITE VISITS WILL BE CONDUCTED A MINIMUM OF ONCE PER MONTH.
B. CDPHE WILL COORDINATE WITH EPA AND WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY RELATIONS ACTIVITIES AS NECESSARY. CONFERENCES AND WORKSHOPS WITH THE PUBLIC ARE NOT ANTICIPATED.
C. CDPHE SHALL MAINTAIN ALL REQUIRED RECORDS AND DOCUMENTS FOR THE PROJECT, INCLUDING DETAILED FINANCIAL RECORDS; MONTHLY STATUS REPORTS; AND DESIGN DOCUMENTS AND MODIFICATIONS.

SITE INSPECTION AND MONITORING: 
CDPHE CURRENTLY MAINTAINS OANDM CONTRACTS WITH ENVIRONMENTAL CONSULTANTS THE FOR INSPECTIONS AND MONITORING OF THE SITE. REGULAR INSPECTIONS OF THE REMEDIES IMPLEMENTED AT OUS 2,5,7 AND 11 ARE REQUIRED TO ENSURE THAT THEY REMAIN PROTECTIVE OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. INSPECTIONS WILL BE CONDUCTED AT A MINIMUM FOR THE FOLLOWING:
-	EROSION
-	FENCING
-	INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS
-	RUN-ON/RUN-OFF CONTROL
-	VEGETATION
-	ZONING
OU12 REQUIRES LONG-TERM MONITORING OF GROUNDWATER, SURFACE WATER AND AQUATIC LIFE TO ENSURE THAT SITE-WIDE WATER QUALITY IS MEETING THE REMEDIAL ACTION OBJECTIVES. MONITORING WILL AT A MINIMUM INCLUDE REGULAR COLLECTION OF ANALYTICAL SAMPLES, DOCUMENTATION OF WATER QUALITY PARAMETERS (INCLUDING DEPTH TO WATER IN GROUNDWATER WELLS), AND REAL-TIME MINE POOL ELEVATION AND ON-LINE FIRST  SYSTEM.
CURRENTLY THE COLLECTION OF ANALYTICAL SAMPLES AND ASSOCIATED WATER QUALITY PARAMETERS IS CONDUCTED BY U.S ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) SUPERFUND TECHNICAL ASSESSMENT AND RESPONSE TEAM (START) CONTRACTORS. THE MINE POOL MONITORING IS CONDUCTED BY CONTRACTORS HIRED BY CDPHE.

MAINTNENANCE: 
IT IS EXPECTED THAT PERIODIC MAINTENANCE OF CERTAIN REMEDY FEATURES WILL BE REQUIRED FOR OUS 2,5,7, AND 12. IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO PREDICT ALL FUTURE MAINTENANCE NEEDS AT THE SITE. HOWEVER, IT WILL INCLUDE, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, THE FOLLOWING REMEDY COMPONENTS.
-	IN-SITU PUMPS, GAUGE STATIONS, AND REAL-TIME MONITORING DEVICES
-	FENCING
-	RUN-ON/RUN-OFF CONTROLS
O	CHANNELS
O	CULVERTS
-	STREAMBANKS
-	VEGETATION
-	WASTE PILE CAPS
O	GEO-TEXTILE MEMBRANES
O	CLEAN SOIL LAYER
-	WELL SECURITY (CAPS AND LOCKS)

REPORTING: 
IT IS NECESSARY TO DOCUMENT THE RESULTS OF THE INSPECTION, MAINTENANCE AND MONITORING ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH OUS 2,5,7,11 AND 12. REGULAR REPORTS WILL BE GENERATED THAT DOCUMENT THE FOLLOWING:
-	ANNUAL INSPECTION OF OU 2,5,7, AND 11 REMEDY COMPONENTS
-	ANNUAL OU12 GROUNDWATER, SURFACE WATER AND AQUATIC LIFE MONITORING
-	MAINTENANCE SUMMARY
-	ANNUAL SUMMARY REPORT OF OU12 GROUNDWATER ELEVATION (MINE POOL)SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES, EXPECTED DELIVERABLES AND INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: 
IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT WITH THE SUPPORT OF THE STATE OF CO, THE REMEDIES FOR OUS 2,5,7,11, AND 12 WILL CONTINUE TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.  ADDITIONALLY FOR OU12, THAT WATER LEVELS IN THE MINE POOL REMAIN SAFE. 
THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE STATE OF COLORADO AND SPECIFICALLY THE PEOPLE OF LAKE COUNTY, COLORADO.

DESCRIPTION:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS THE RECIPIENTS PROGRAM TO CONDUCT REMEDIAL DESIGN ACTIVITIES AND INSTALLATION OF IN-SITU THERMAL REMEDIATION (ISTR) SYSTEM AT THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT GREAT LAKES AND ENERGY WASH KING HAZARDOUS WASTE SITE, WHICH IS LISTED ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITY LIST (NPL) OF THE NATIONAL OIL AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CONTINGENCY PLAN.ACTIVITIES:THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT, GREAT LAKES, AND ENERGY (EGLE) IS THE LEAD AGENCY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SITE WITH SUPPORT FROM THE U.S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (U.S. EPA).  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE STATE OF MICHIGAN SELECTED REMEDY FOR THE WASH KING SITE  IS INTENDED TO REMEDIATE EACH OF THE THREE SOURCE AREAS, THAT EXTEND TO DEPTHS OF AS MUCH AS 60 FEET BELOW GROUND SURFACE.  THE SITE IS PROVIDED POTABLE WATER VIA A TYPE I WATER SUPPLY SYSTEM THAT WAS PART OF THE OPERABLE UNIT 1 (OU-1) REMEDIAL ACTION (RA), AND IT IS RECOGNIZED IN THE OU-2 ROD THAT COMPONENTS OF THAT SYSTEM. DESCRIPTION:
WDNR WILL PERFORM REMEDIAL ACTION WORK AT THE PENTA WOOD PRODUCTS SUPERFUND SITE, IN SIREN, WISCONSIN MAY 1, 2022 - APRIL 30, 2024.  WDNR WILL EXCAVATE AND REMOVE IMPACTED SOIL/SEDIMENT AND MITIGATE AND COVER IMPACTED SURFACE DEBRIS IN PLACE.  BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL) FUNDS WILL BE USED IN THE AMOUNT $1,397,637.

ACTIVITIES:
THE REMEDIAL ACTION WORK WILL INCLUDE EXCAVATING AND REMOVING IMPACTED SOIL AND SEDIMENT FROM THE WETLAND AT PROPERTIES LOCATED ADJACENT TO THE SITE AND PLACING THIS IMPACTED MATERIAL WITHIN AN EXPANDED CORRECTIVE ACTION MANAGEMENT UNIT ON THE SITE PROPERTY. WETLAND EXCAVATION WORK WILL INCLUDE WETLAND SOIL/SEDIMENT EXCAVATION; CONFIRMATION SAMPLING; RELOCATION, PLACEMENT, COMPACTION, AND GRADING OF THE EXCAVATED MATERIAL; COVER MATERIAL PLACEMENT; FENCING RELOCATION; AND WELL MODIFICATIONS. 

OUTCOMES:

THE REMOVAL OF THE IMPACTED SOIL AND SEDIMENT FROM ADJACENT PROPERTIES AND COVERING IMPACTED SURFACE DEBRIS AT THE PENTA WOOD PROPERTY IS THE MOST EFFECTIVE METHOD TO REDUCE LONG-TERM ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS ASSOCIATED WITH THESE MATERIALS. THE ACTIONS WILL ADDRESS CONCERNS WITH DIRECT CONTACT WITH SITE CONTAMINANTS AND PROVIDE PROTECTION TO THE GROUNDWATER AND DRINKING WATER WELLS IN THE AREA.  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE CITIZENS IN THE TOWN OF SIREN AND THE PEOPLE OF BURNETT COUNTY, WISCONSIN.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (W-DNR) WILL PERFORM A GROUNDWATER INVESTIGATION TO CHECK FOR THE CONTAMINATE PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES ('PFAS') AT THE TOXIC WASTE SITE KNOWN AS THE 'BETTER BRITE PLATING CO. CHROME AND ZINC SHOPS SUPERFUND SITE' IN BROWN COUNTY, WISCONSIN. THE W-DNR WILL PERFORM THE ROLE OF PROVIDING OVERSIGHT ON THE PFAS GROUNDWATER INVESTIGATION IS TO ENSURE THAT THE PROJECT IS PERFORMED CONSISTENT WITH REGULATIONS. 
ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: EDUCATING HOMEOWNERS ABOUT WHERE SAMPLING WILL TAKE PLACE ON PFAS AND OBTAINING PROPERTY ACCESS AGREEMENTS WHERE NECESSARY; DEVELOPING AND SUBMITTING A QAPP TO EPA; COLLECTING AND ANALYZING GROUNDWATER SAMPLES FROM 31 MONITORING POINTS; SUBMITTING LAB DATA TO EPA FOR ANALYTICAL DATA VALIDATION; PERFORMING PROJECT-LEVEL DATA VALIDATION AND SUBMITTING RESULTS TO EPA; PREPARING AND SUBMITTING A 'PROJECT-LEVEL DATA VALIDATION REPORT'; AND PREPARING AND SUBMITTING A 'PFAS GROUNDWATER INVESTIGATION REPORT'.

OUTCOMES:

THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE COMMUNITY EDUCATION, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND ACTIONABLE DATA RESULTS FROM THE PFAS GROUNDWATER INVESTIGATION. THIS PROJECT WILL IDENTIFY IF THE GROUNDWATER AT THE SITE IS IMPACTED AND PROVIDE THE DATA NECESSARY TO DETERMINE IF ANY REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES NEED TO TAKE PLACE. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF WISCONSIN.

WDNR WILL PERFORM A GROUNDWATER INVESTIGATION TO CHECK FOR THE CONTAMINATE PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES ('PFAS') AT THE OCONOMOWOC ELECTROPLATING COMPANY, INC. SUPERFUND SITE APRIL 1, 2022 - MARCH 31, 2023.
ACTIVITIES:
WDNR WILL PERFORM PROJECT OVERSIGHT IN WRITING OF THE QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN ('QAPP') AND FIELD ACTIVITIES PARTICIPATION IN PROJECT MEETINGS, PROVIDE AGENCY REPORTING AND SUPPORT, AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL INPUT TO THE CONTRACTORS.

OUTCOMES:
THE PURPOSE OF THE WDNR OVERSIGHT ON THE PFAS GROUNDWATER INVESTIGATION IS TO ENSURE THAT THE PROJECT IS PERFORMED CONSISTENT WITH REGULATIONS. THIS PROJECT WILL IDENTIFY IF THE GROUNDWATER AT THE SITE IS IMPACTED AND PROVIDE THE DATA NECESSARY TO DETERMINE IF ANY REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES NEED TO TAKE
PLACE.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
FOR THE PERIOD APRIL 1, 2022, TO SEPTEMBER 30, 2023, WDNR WILL OVERSEE THE VAPOR INTRUSION INVESTIGATION AT THE N. W. MAUTHE SUPERFUND SITE.  THE WDNR HAS A LONG HISTORY OF WORKING ON INVESTIGATION AND CLEANUP PROJECTS AT THE N. W. MAUTHE SUPERFUND SITE.  GIVEN THE PRESENCE OF MULTIPLE VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS IN THE GROUNDWATER EPA REQUESTED WDNR INVESTIGATE THE RISK OF VAPOR INTRUSION.  

ACTIVITIES:
WDNR OUTPUTS OF THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL INCLUDE COMMUNITY EDUCATION, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND OVERSIGHT OF ITS CONTRACTOR DURING THE VI INVESTIGATION.  DURING THIS PROJECT PERIOD, WDNR WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING: PROJECT OVERSIGHT DURING WRITING OF THE QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN AND FIELD ACTIVITIES, COORDINATION OF COMMUNITY EDUCATION, PARTICIPATION IN PROJECT MEETINGS, AGENCY REPORTING AND SUPPORT AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL INPUT TO THE CONTRACTOR

OUTCOMES:
THE PURPOSE OF WDNR'S OVERSIGHT ON THE VAPOR INTRUSION INVESTIGATION IS TO ASSIST WITH COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND TO ENSURE THAT THE PROJECT IS PERFORMED CONSISTENT WITH REGULATIONS. THIS PROJECT WILL IDENTIFY IF BUILDINGS AT THE SITE ARE BEING IMPACTED BY VAPORS FROM THE CONTAMINATED GROUNDWATER AND PROVIDE THE DATA NECESSARY TO DETERMINE IF MITIGATION IS NECESSARY.
DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE CITIZENS IN APPLETON, WISCONSIN AND OTHER GROUPS THAT WILL BENEFIT FROM THE GRANT.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION'S PROGRAM TO CONDUCT REMEDIAL ACTION ACTIVITIES AT THE CALLAHAN MINE SUPERFUND SITE, WHICH IS LISTED ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) OF THE NATIONAL OIL AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CONTINGENCY PLAN.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING SITE-SPECIFIC ACTIONS:

1.) REPLACE THREE EXISTING ROAD CULVERTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE CALLAHAN MINE SUPERFUND SITE. 
2.) PAVE APPROXIMATELY TWO MILES OF CAPE ROSIER ROAD IN BROOKSVILLE, MAINE.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE THE REPLACEMENT OF THREE EXISTING ROAD CULVERTS AND THE PAVING OF APPROXIMATELY TWO MILES OF CAPE ROSIER ROAD IN BROOKSVILLE, MAINE. THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS TO EFFECTIVELY MITIGATE FOR ROAD DAMAGE CAUSED BY THE HAULING OF EQUIPMENT AND MATERIALS TO THE CALLAHAN MINE SUPERFUND SITE. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE RESIDENTS OF BROOKSVILLE, MAINE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT MAY FUND THE PARTICIPATION OF THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION IN ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE REVIEW OF REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AND FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND RECORDS OF DECISION AT SUPERFUND SITES IN CONNECTICUT WHEN THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) IS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR REMEDIAL ACTION. THIS CAN ALSO INCLUDE REVIEW OF INFORMATION, ATTENDING SITE-RELATED MEETINGS AND PARTICIPATING IN FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS.ACTIVITIES:THE PURPOSE OF MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE FOR REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES AT NATIONAL PRIORITY LIST (NPL) SITES IS TO ALLOW THE STATE TO REVIEW SIGNIFICANT DOCUMENTS PRODUCED AS PART OF A PROJECT, ATTEND IMPORTANT MEETINGS ABOUT SITE PROGRAMS, MAKE SITE VISITS, ENSURE CONSISTENCY WITH THE STATE'S ENVIRONMENTAL STANDARDS, AND ADVISE THE US ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) ON THE CONTENT AND APPLICATION OF APPLICABLE OR RELEVANT AND APPROPRIATE STATE STANDARDS (ARARS). THE STATE ALSO PARTICIPATES IN NEGOTIATIONS WITH EPA AND THE POTENTIALLY RESPONSIBLE PARTIES (PRPS) PERTAINING TO THE SITES. THERE ARE SEVERAL PHASES OF REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES AT NPL SITES, INCLUDING REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION/FEASIBILITY STUDY (RI/FS), REMEDIAL DESIGN (RD), REMEDIAL ACTION (RA), AND OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE (OANDM). THE STATE ALSO PARTICIPATES IN FIVE YEAR REVIEWS (FYRS) AND REUSE ASSESSMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE PROJECTED ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOME OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS WILL BE PROPERLY MAINTAINED AND MONITORED REMEDIES AT THE APPLICABLE SUPERFUND SITES, WHICH WILL REMAIN PROTECTIVE OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AND COMPLY WITH ARARS. THE EVENTUAL EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS THE DE-LISTING OF THE APPLICABLE SUPERFUND SITES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION'S PROGRAM TO CONDUCT A REMEDIAL ACTION AND LONG-TERM RESPONSE ACTION AT THE COMMERCE STREET PLUME HAZARDOUS WASTE SITE, WHICH IS LISTED ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST OF THE NATIONAL OIL AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CONTINGENCY PLAN. ACTIVITIES:1.) DEC WILL ACT AS THE LEAD PARTY IN THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE REMEDIAL ACTION AT THE COMMERCE STREET PLUME NPL SITE. THIS REMEDIAL ACTION WAS SELECTED IN THE SEPTEMBER 2015 RECORD OF DECISION AND MODIFIED AS DOCUMENTED IN THE 2022 EXPLANATION OF SIGNIFICANT
DIFFERENCES.

2.) ASSESSMENT OF ARCHEOLOGICALLY SENSITIVE AREAS PRIOR TO DISTURBANCE AND DOCUMENTATION OF ANY SIGNIFICANT SITES.

3.) INSTALLATION OF INJECTION WELLS AND BIOBARRIER TRENCHES FOR IN SITU BIOREMEDIATION.

4.) INJECTION OF AMENDMENTS TO ENHANCE BIOREMEDIATION.

5.) GROUNDWATER MONITORING TO ASSESS PERFORMANCE OF THE REMEDY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE OUTCOME OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS THE TREATMENT OF CONTAMINATED GROUNDWATER IN ORDER TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND RESTORE THE GROUNDWATER RESOURCE TO HIGH QUALITY DRINKING WATER. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE RESIDENTS OF WILLISTON, VERMONT.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS SITE-SPECIFIC COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL BE USED FOR FUNDING THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION (DEC) FOR THE FOLLOWING:
- TO HIRE A CONTRACTOR TO PERFORM ARCHEOLOGICAL WORK (DATA RECOVERY AND PRE-CONSTRUCTION SITE DOCUMENTATION) THAT IS REQUIRED AS PART OF THE REMEDIAL ACTION BUT MUST BE PERFORMED PRIOR TO GROUND DISTURBING COMPONENTS OF THE REMEDIAL ACTION BEGINNING AT THE ELY COPPER MINE SUPERFUND SITE IN VERSHIRE, VERMONT, AND
- TO PROVIDE SITE SPECIFIC OVERSIGHT OF THE CONTRACTOR'S WORK.

DATA RECOVERY AND PRE-CONSTRUCTION SITE DOCUMENTATION IS ALSO A REQUIREMENT IN THE SIGNED MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT (MOA) AMONG THE U.S. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA), DEC, AND THE VERMONT STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (SHPO) FOR CLEANUP OF THE ELY COPPER MINE IN VERSHIRE, VERMONT, NOVEMBER 2019.
ACTIVITIES:
ACTIVITIES ANTICIPATED TO BE COMPLETED BY EITHER VT DEC OR THEIR CONTRACTOR, INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:
REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL (RFP) PREPARATION, CONTRACTOR SELECTION, AND CONTRACT AWARD
- DEVELOP REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL PACKAGE (RFP) AND AWARD A CONTRACT TO A CONTRACTOR FOR PERFORMING THE ARCHEOLOGICAL WORK. AFTER AN OPPORTUNITY TO REVIEW AND COMMENT BY EPA AND THE SHPO, THE RFP WILL BE FINALIZED.

FIELD INVESTIGATION AND DATA RECOVERY ACTIVITIES
-PERFORM A SITE RECONNAISSANCE OF THE UPPER AND LOWER WASTE AREAS AND THE ELY BROOK TRIBUTARIES TO DETERMINE IF ANY ADDITIONAL FEATURES HAVE BEEN EXPOSED OR IDENTIFIED SINCE THE ORIGINAL RECORDING ON THE PREVIOUS GIS MAPS.
- DEVELOP AND FINALIZE APPLICABLE SITE WORK PLANS, WHICH INCLUDES, AT A MINIMUM, A HEALTH AND SAFETY PLAN (HASP), AND A SEDIMENT AND EROSION PREVENTION PLAN.
- REVIEW AND APPROVE APPLICABLE WORK PLANS.
- UPDATE GPS SITE MAP AND GIS DATABASE, AS NECESSARY, TO REFLECT ANY NEWLY IDENTIFIED HISTORIC FEATURES.
- PERFORM REQUIRED FIELD INVESTIGATION, INCLUDING SUBMITTALS OF PROGRESS REPORTS CONSISTENT WITH THE APPROVED CONTRACT. THIS ACTIVITY WILL ALSO LIKELY INCLUDE MOBILIZATION, CLEARING, SHOVEL TEST PITS, TEST UNITS, BACKHOE TRENCHING, BACKFILLING, DEMOBILIZATION FROM THE SITE AND REGULAR COORDINATION WITH STAKEHOLDERS.
- PROCESS AND CURATE RECOVERED HISTORIC RESOURCES.
- OVERSEE SITE RECONNAISSANCE, SITE MOBILIZATION AND FIELD EFFORTS PERFORMED BY CONTRACTOR.

TECHNICAL REPORTS
- PREPARE AND FINALIZE TECHNICAL REPORT(S) AND OTHER DELIVERABLES SPECIFIED IN THE CONTRACT DETAILING THE DATA RECOVERY ACTIVITIES INCLUDING THE RESULTS AND INTERPRETATION OF HISTORIC FEATURES
- REVIEW AND APPROVE APPLICABLE TECHNICAL REPORT(S) AND OTHER DELIVERABLES PROVIDED BY THE CONTRACTOR.
- SUBMIT TECHNICAL REPORT TO EPA AND THE SHPO AS SPECIFIED IN THE MOA
OUTCOMES:
OUTPUTS (DELIVERABLES): 
1.) A CONTRACT AWARD TO A QUALIFIED CONTRACTOR TO PERFORM THE ARCHEOLOGICAL ACTIVITIES (DATA RECOVERY AND PRE-CONSTRUCTION SITE DOCUMENTATION) TO DOCUMENT ANY HISTORIC RESOURCES THAT WILL BE ADVERSELY IMPACTED BY THE REMEDIAL ACTION, AS REQUIRED IN THE MOA AMONG EPA, VT DEC, AND THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (SHPO)
2.) WORK PLANS FOR CARRYING OUT THE SPECIFIC SCOPE OF WORK OUTLINED IN THE AWARDED CONTRACT.
3.) FIELD INVESTIGATION AND DATA RECOVERY WITH REGULAR PROGRESS REPORTS SO EPA, VT DEC, AND SHPO CAN ASSESS ONGOING DATA RECOVERY EFFORTS.
4.) VT DEC WILL COORDINATE WITH EPA AND SHPO TO ENSURE THE WORK PLANS AND THE ONGOING DATA RECOVERY ACTIVITIES AND DOCUMENTATION ACHIEVE THE DELIVERABLES THAT ARE NECESSARY TO SATISFY THE REQUIREMENTS RELATED TO MITIGATING HISTORIC RESOURCES IN THE MOA.

OUTCOMES:
1.) THIS ACTIVITY IS NECESSARY TO ALLOW FOR THE GROUND-DISTURBING COMPONENTS OF THE REMEDIAL ACTION, WHICH WILL MITIGATE SURFACE WATER AND GROUNDWATER POLLUTION ONSITE AND OFFSITE DUE TO THE LEACHING OF ACID MINE DRAINAGE FROM ABANDONED MINE WASTE PILES. MINE WASTE THAT PRESENTS AN ACID MINE DRAINAGE THREAT, WHICH ALSO EXCEEDS SOIL AND SEDIMENT CLEANUP LEVELS, WILL BE CONSOLIDATED ON SITE WITHIN A CONTAINMENT CELL TO PREVENT LEACHI

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICE'S PROGRAM TO CONDUCT A SUPPLEMENTAL REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION FOR PFAS AT THE TROY MILLS HAZARDOUS WASTE SITE, WHICH IS LISTED ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST OF THE NATIONAL OIL AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CONTINGENCY PLAN.  ACTIVITIES:1.) FILL IN DATA GAPS RELATED TO PFAS PLUME EXTENT, BOTH HORIZONTALLY AND VERTICALLY, AND SOURCE AREAS.
2.) DETERMINE EFFECTIVENESS OF EASEMENT-ESTABLISHED GROUNDWATER MANAGEMENT ZONE, THE INSTITUTIONAL CONTROL UPON WHICH THE REMEDY RELIES.
3.) PROVIDE DATA SUPPORT FOR ADDITIONAL RI, FS, AND/OR DECISIONS DOCUMENT ACTIVITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:4.) MEANINGFUL AND SUBSTANTIAL INVOLVEMENT BY THE STATE IN THE REMEDIATION OF THE SITE.
5.) IMPLEMENTATION OF THE ROD, ESD, AND FIVE-YEAR REVIEW.
6.) SITE RESTRICTIONS WILL NO LONGER BE NEEDED.
7.) SITE DELISTED FROM NPL.

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE RESIDENTS OF TROY, NEW HAMPSHIRE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICE'S PROGRAM TO CONDUCT A SUPPLEMENTAL REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AT THE MOTTOLO PIG FARM HAZARDOUS WASTE SITE, WHICH IS LISTED ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST OF THE NATIONAL OIL AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CONTINGENCY PLAN.ACTIVITIES:THE NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (NHDES) PORTION OF THIS FUNDING WILL BE UTILIZED TO PROVIDE PROJECT MANAGEMENT AND OVERSIGHT SUPPORT FOR THE SUPPLEMENTAL INVESTIGATION ACTIVITIES AT THE MOTTOLO PIG FARM SUPERFUND SITE. SUPPORT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO; REVIEW AND COMMENT ON WORK PLANS, PERIODIC OVERSIGHT OF INVESTIGATION ACTIVITIES, AND THE REVIEW AND COMMENT ON THE FINDINGS OF THE SUPPLEMENTAL INVESTIGATION. COSTS ARE ALSO INCLUDED FOR IN-STATE TRAVEL FOR SITE VISITS TO OBSERVE INVESTIGATION ACTIVITIES. 

CONTRACTUAL ASSISTANCE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL INCLUDE THE INSTALLATION OF A MONITORING WELL TRIPLET, WITH SCREENED INTERVALS WITHIN THE UNCONSOLIDATED DEPOSITS, SHALLOW BEDROCK, AND DEEP BEDROCK AQUIFERS AT THE SITE. WELL INSTALLATION WILL BE FOLLOWED BY BOREHOLE GEOPHYSICAL LOGGING, DISCRETE WELL INSTALLATION, AND SUBSEQUENT GROUNDWATER SAMPLING TO REFINE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF PFAS AT THE SITE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (NHDES) SEEKS FEDERAL FUNDING THROUGH A NEW COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WITH EPA TO SUPPORT NHDES PERSONNEL INVOLVEMENT AS WELL AS CONTRACTUAL ASSISTANCE WITH THE COMPLETION OF THE SUPPLEMENTAL REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE THE UNDERSTANDING OF PFAS AND ITS OCCURRENCE AT THE MOTTOLO PIG FARM SITE. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE RESIDENTS OF RAYMOND, NEW HAMPSHIRE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICE'S PROGRAM TO CONDUCT REMEDIAL DESIGN/ REMEDIAL ACTION OVERSIGHT ACTIVITIES AT THE BEEDE WASTE OIL SUPERFUND SITE, WHICH IS LISTED ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST OF THE NATIONAL OIL AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CONTINGENCY PLAN. ACTIVITIES:WITHIN GRANT PERIOD NHDES WILL:
1.) OVERSEE STATE CONTRACTOR WHO WILL PROVIDE REMEDIAL DESIGN REVIEW AND REMEDIAL ACTION OVERSIGHT SERVICES.
2.) PERFORM ALL REPORTING REQUIREMENTS OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT ARE: 
1.) MEANINGFUL AND SUBSTANTIAL INVOLVEMENT BY THE STATE IN THE REMEDIATION OF THE SITE.
2.) IMPLEMENTATION OF THE ROD, ESD, AND FIVE-YEAR REVIEW.
3.) RETURN THE SITE TO PRODUCTIVE USE.
4.) COSTS RECOVERED.
5.) SITE DELISTED FROM NPL.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE RECIPIENT'S PROGRAM TO CONDUCT A SUPPLEMENTAL REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION FOR POLY- AND PERFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES (PFAS) AT THE OTTATI AND GOSS HAZARDOUS WASTE SITE, WHICH IS LISTED ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST OF THE NATIONAL OIL AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CONTINGENCY PLAN.ACTIVITIES:WITHIN THE GRANT PERIOD, THE NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (NHDES) WILL OVERSEE A STATE CONTRACTOR WHO WILL PERFORM A SUPPLEMENTAL INVESTIGATION TOWARD DEFINING THE NATURE AND EXTENT OF THE EMERGING CONTAMINANT PFAS IN BEDROCK, SEDIMENTS, AND SURFACE WATER AS WELL AS INVESTIGATE THE PRESENCE IN UNSATURATED SITE SOILS. ADDITIONALLY, NHDES WILL PERFORM ALL REPORTING REQUIREMENTS OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED OUTPUTS OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE: 1.) EVALUATE THE EXTENT OF THE PFAS PLUME; 2.) DATA ON THE NATURE AND EXTENT OF THE EMERGING CONTAMINANTS WILL BE COLLECTED AND INTERPRETED; 3.) THE SITE CONCEPTUAL MODEL WILL BE UPDATED; 4.) THE POTENTIAL FOR BENEFICIAL REUSE OF THE PROPERTY WILL BE ENHANCED; AND PARTICIPATION IN TECHNICAL MEETINGS AND CONFERENCE CALLS. 

THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE: 1.) MEANINGFUL AND SUBSTANTIAL INVOLVEMENT BY THE STATE IN THE REMEDIATION OF THE SITE; 2.) IMPLEMENTATION OF THE ROD, ESD AND FIVE-YEAR REVIEW; 3.) SITE RESTRICTIONS WILL NO LONGER BE NEEDED; AND 4.) THE SITE WILL BE DELISTED FROM THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST. 

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE RESIDENTS OF KINGSTON, NEW HAMPSHIRE.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES, BUT WILL SUPPORT THE RECIPIENTS RESPONSE PROGRAM UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISIONAND COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND CONTRACT ADMINISTRATIONAND FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITYAND LEGAL ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING COST RECOVERY AND LITIGATION ACTIVITIESAND AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL CLERICAL/TECHNICAL SUPPORT. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE.

THIS AGREEMENT MAY FUND THE PARTICIPATION OF THE NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (NHDES) IN ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE REVIEW OF REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AND FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND RECORDS OF DECISION AT SUPERFUND SITES IN THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE WHEN THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) IS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR REMEDIAL ACTION. THIS CAN ALSO INCLUDE REVIEW OF INFORMATION, ATTENDING SITE-RELATED MEETINGS AND PARTICIPATING IN FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS. THE OUTCOME OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY THE NHDES TO ENSURE ITS MEANINGFUL AND SUBSTANTIAL INVOLVEMENT AT SUPERFUND SITES IN NEW HAMPSHIRE WHERE THE EPA IS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR REMEDIAL ACTION. THE PROPOSED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT MAY FUND THE PARTICIPATION OF THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT IN ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE REVIEW OF REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AND FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND RECORDS OF DECISION AT SUPERFUND SITES IN THE STATE OF RHODE ISLAND WHEN THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) IS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR REMEDIAL ACTION.  THIS CAN ALSO INCLUDE REVIEW OF INFORMATION, ATTENDING SITE-RELATED MEETINGS AND PARTICIPATING IN FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS. 
THE ACTIVITIES THAT RIDEM PLANS TO CONDUCT DURING THE PROJECT PERIOD OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE: 1.) REVIEW AND COMMENT ON TECHNICAL DOCUMENTS; 2.) COORDINATE REVIEWS WITH OTHER STATE AGENCIES; 3.) PARTICIPATION IN PUBLIC MEETINGS AND HEARINGS, AS WELL AS MEETINGS BETWEEN EPA AND OTHER PARTIES; 4.) REVIEW AND COMMENT ON PRESS RELEASES AND FACT SHEETS; 5.) GAIN ACCESS TO RESIDENCES VIA SIGNED ACCESS AGREEMENTS; 6.) ASSIST EPA AND ITS CONTRACTOR(S) WITH FIELD ACTIVITIES THROUGH OVERSIGHT AND SITE VISITS; THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE: 1.) MEANINGFUL AND SUBSTANTIAL INVOLVEMENT BY THE STATE IN REMEDIAL RESPONSE ACTIVITIES; 2.) IDENTIFICATION OF FINAL REMEDY AND STATE CONCURRENCE; 3.) RETURN SITES TO PRODUCTIVE USE; 4.) COSTS RECOVERED; AND 5.) SITES DELISTED FROM NPL. 

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF RHODE ISLAND.ACTIVITIES:-SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:-

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE RECIPIENT'S PROGRAM TO CONDUCT REMEDIAL DESIGN/ REMEDIAL ACTION OVERSIGHT ACTIVITIES AT THE CHLOR-ALKALI HAZARDOUS WASTE SITE, WHICH IS LISTED ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) OF THE NATIONAL OIL AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES CONTINGENCY PLAN.ACTIVITIES:THE NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (NHDES) WILL OVERSEE A STATE CONTRACTOR WHO WILL BE PERFORMING REMEDIAL DESIGN AND REMEDIAL ACTION OVERSIGHT TASKS INCLUDING DOCUMENT REVIEW AND FIELD OVERSIGHT. ADDITIONALLY, NHDES WILL PERFORM ALL OF THE REPORTING REQUIREMENTS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES (OUTPUTS) OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE:

1.) PRE-DESIGN INVESTIGATIONS WILL FILL IN DATA GAPS RELATED TO HORIZONTAL AND VERTICAL LIMITS OF SOIL CONTAMINANTS IN THE EFSA AND SFSA IN ADDITION TO LIMITS OF BEDROCK GROUNDWATER CONTAMINATION AND EVALUATION OF THE NEED AND EFFICACY OF ISCO TREATMENT. 

2.) CONTINUED MERCURY REMOVALS FROM THE RIVER AND ASSESSMENT OF OCCURRENCE WILL REDUCE CONTAMINANT LOADING TO THE RIVER. 

3.) A 100% REMEDIAL DESIGN.

4.) REMEDIAL ACTION WORK PLAN AND EXECUTION OF 100% DESIGN. 

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE RESIDENTS OF BERLIN, NEW HAMPSHIRE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT MAY FUND THE PARTICIPATION OF THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION IN ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE REVIEW OF REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AND FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND RECORDS OF DECISION AT SUPERFUND SITES IN THE STATE OF MAINE WHEN THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) IS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR REMEDIAL ACTION. THIS CAN ALSO INCLUDE REVIEW OF INFORMATION, ATTENDING SITE-RELATED MEETINGS AND PARTICIPATING IN FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS.ACTIVITIES:THE PURPOSE OF MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE IS TO ALLOW THE STATE TO MONITOR PROGRESS AND CONSULT MEANINGFULLY WITH EPA ABOUT THESE ACTIVITIES; STATES MAY REVIEW SIGNIFICANT DOCUMENTS
PRODUCED AS PART OF A PROJECT, ATTEND IMPORTANT MEETINGS ABOUT SITE PROGRAMS, AND CONDUCT SITE VISITS. MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE APPLIES TO BOTH ENFORCEMENT-LEAD AND FUND-LEAD
REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES. STATE MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES ARE ESSENTIALLY THE SAME FOR BOTH TYPES OF PROJECTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE: 
1.) MAINTAINING OPEN COMMUNICATION BETWEEN THE SETTLING PARTIES GROUP, AGENCIES, AND CONCERNED PUBLIC. 
2.) THE PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.
3.) A PROPERLY SELECTED AND IMPLEMENTED REMEDY, WHICH WILL RESTORE THE SITE TO ITS ANTICIPATED USE. 
4.) THE EVENTUAL DE-LISTING OF THE SITES. 

THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF MAINE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION'S PROGRAM TO PERFORM SITE CHARACTERIZATION ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PRELIMINARY ASSESSMENTS AND SITE INSPECTIONS AT POTENTIAL OR CONFIRMED HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES. ACTIVITIES:THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE:
1. DETERMINE THE NEED FOR FEDERAL INVOLVEMENT AT SITES WITH SUSPECTED OR CONFIRMED RELEASES OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS.
2. EVALUATE THE STATUS OF SITES CURRENTLY ON SUPERFUND ENTERPRISE MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (SEMS).
3. RECOMMEND CHANGES IN STATUS WHERE APPROPRIATE, INCLUDING FURTHER FEDERAL ACTION, NPL LISTING, AND ARCHIVING.
4. RECOMMEND ADDITION OF NEW SITES TO SEMS FOR ASSESSMENT BY EPA.
5. ASSIST IN NPL PROPOSAL AND LISTING ACTIVITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE: MEANINGFUL AND SUBSTANTIAL INVOLVEMENT BY THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION IN PRE-REMEDIAL RESPONSE ACTIVITIES, FINAL ASSESSMENT DECISIONS, IDENTIFYING PROPERTIES REQUIRING NO FURTHER ACTION AND LISTING OF SITES ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL).

THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICE'S (NHDES'S) PROGRAM TO PERFORM SITE CHARACTERIZATION ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PRELIMINARY ASSESSMENTS AND SITE INSPECTIONS AT POTENTIAL OR CONFIRMED HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES.

THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL UTILIZE THE FUNDING TO OBTAIN THE THE CONTRACTED SUPPORT OF A REAL-ESTATE ATTORNEY TO DRAFT PERMANENT  EASEMENTS THAT PROVIDES EPA, MAINE DEP, AND ITS AGENTS PERMISSION TO ACCESS AND INSTALL BOTH TEMPORARY AND PERMANENT FEATURES ON TWO PROPERTIES ADJACENT TO THE TAILING IMPOUNDMENT AT THE CALLAHAN MINE SUPERFUND SITE. THE EASEMENTS WILL ALLOW FOR THE INSTALLATION OF BOTH TEMPORARY AND PERMANENT FEATURES INCLUDING ACCESS ROADS, STORMWATER BASINS, PASSIVE TREATMENT SYSTEMS, DRILLING PLATFORMS AND WELL VAULTS; TEMPORARY DAMS, AND OTHER FEATURES NECESSARY TO COMPLETE AND MONITOR THE SUCCESS OF THE OU3 REMEDIAL ACTION AT THE CALLAHAN MINE SITE IN BROOKSVILLE, MAINE.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (RIDEM) IN ORDER TO SUPPORT THE THIRD FIVE-YEAR REVIEW AT THE ROSE HILL LANDFILL SUPERFUND SITE. THE PURPOSE OF THE FIVE-YEAR REVIEW IS TO DETERMINE WHETHER THE REMEDY AT THE SITE IS PROTECTIVE OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE SUPPORT PROVIDED WILL INCLUDE DOCUMENT REVIEW, DATA ANALYSIS, A SITE INSPECTION, AND THE PREPARATION OF A THIRD FIVE-YEAR REVIEW REPORT.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE SITE-SPECIFIC FUNDING TO THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION (VT DEC) FOR NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) SUPPORT AGENCY ACTIVITIES. SUPPORT AGENCY ACTIVITIES ENSURE MEANINGFUL AND SUBSTANTIAL INVOLVEMENT BY THE VT DEC DURING THE DIFFERENT PHASES OF REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES AT NPL SITES.

PER YOUR APPLICATION REQUEST DATED JUNE 29, 2017, THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS BEING FULLY FUNDED IN THE AMOUNT $225,000 TO THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO CONDUCT PRE-REMEDIAL (SITE ASSESSMENT) ACTIVITIES WHICH INVOLVES THE INVESTIGATION, EVALUATION, AND ASSESSMENT OF UNCONTROLLED HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES.

PER YOUR APPLICATION REQUEST DATED MAY 31, 2017, THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT  AWARDS FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $837,319 TO THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION. THESE FUNDS WILL ASSIST WITH THE SUPERFUND BLOCK FUNDING COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IN COMBINING BOTH CORE PROGRAM AND NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) SUPPORT AGENCY ACTIVITIES.  NPL SUPPORT AGENCY ACTIVITIES ENSURE MEANINGFUL AND SUBSTANTIAL INVOLVEMENT BY THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION DURING THE DIFFERENT PHASES OF REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES AT NPL SITES.  CORE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES ARE INTENDED TO SUPPORT THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTIONS ABILITY TO PARTICIPATE IN THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA) RESPONSE PROGRAM AND ARE NOT DIRECTLY ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES.
